page.title: 01Introduction to the Area
page.content: The Area is made up of several very large council estates. Many of the houses are early 20th. Century terrace house with small gardens, extremely large pavements and narrow roads. A great many of them are in a delapidated condition and the living standards of the inhabitants is poor, with very few facilities and fewer services. Unemployment and poverty are everpresent reminders of the ills of society along with damaged properties, boarded up buildings and depressed people. A pleasant aspect of the area is the occurence of large parks and green areas. These certainly break up the drabness of the landscape and allow the population open spaces to walk, exercise and hld their sporing events.
